recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.description: A classic Indian-inspired dish with tender chicken in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce. Perfect served with rice or naan bread.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Arrange marinated chicken on a baking sheet.
Bake chicken for 20-25 minutes until cooked through.
In a large pan, heat oil and sauté onions until translucent.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Cut baked chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Add chicken to the sauce and stir in heavy cream.
Simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

comments.text: Absolutely delicious! The spices were perfectly balanced. Will definitely make again.
Great recipe. Tip: marinate the chicken overnight for even more flavor.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.description: A rich and hearty French classic beef stew, slow-cooked to perfection with red wine, bacon, and herbs.
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into cubes
instructions: Season beef with salt and pepper.
Cook bacon in a large Dutch oven until crisp.
Brown beef cubes in bacon fat in batches.
Sauté onions, carrots, and garlic in the same pot.
Add wine, broth, tomato paste, and bouquet garni.
Return beef to the pot and simmer for 2-2.5 hours.
Sauté pearl onions and mushrooms separately.
Add sautéed vegetables to the stew in the last 30 minutes.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve hot with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.

comments.text: Authentic French recipe! Takes time but absolutely worth it.
Pro tip: Use a good quality red wine for the best flavor.

recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A creamy Italian pasta dish with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
Cook pancetta in a large skillet until crisp.
Whisk eggs, cheeses, and black pepper in a bowl.
Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
Quickly mix hot pasta with egg mixture.
Add pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Mix in crispy pancetta.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

comments.text: Authentic Italian carbonara. No cream needed!
